alert.note: Alert for Dale; Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 9:57AM CDT until June 15 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN DALE AND NORTHERN HENRY COUNTIES... At 957 AM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Henry county along State Hwy 10 at West Washington and Lightfoot Rd has caused the road to flood. Between 3.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 Hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Abbeville, Graball, Abbeville Municipal A/P, Lawrenceville, Murphy Station, Screamer, Scottsboro Crossroads, Edwin, Willis Crossroads, Clopton and Barefield Crossroads. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
